definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: It will generate 1,260 megawatts of electricity, most of  which will be sold to Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 它的發電量達1260兆瓦特，其中大部分賣給泰國。

sentences.english: There hasn't been a substantial drop-off in the growth of power generation fueling China's growth.
sentences.chinese: 推動中國經濟增長的發電量增速並沒有出現明顯下降。

sentences.english: Electricty generation amount ranks first in the world.
It ranks far below France, where nuclear power makes up three-quarters of electricity production.
sentences.chinese: 後者的核能發電量佔到了總髮電量的四分之三。

sentences.english: A case in point is the generating capacity of renewables.
sentences.chinese: 在這一點上，典型的例子便是可再生能源的發電量。

sentences.english: China boasts the most installed renewable electricity capacity of any country in the world.
sentences.chinese: 中國自吹擁有全世界最多的可再生能源發電量。

definition: (computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)
